metadata.title: CVE-2022-48691 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:netfilter: nf_tables: clean up hook list when offload flags check failssplice back the hook list so nft_chain_release_hook() has a chance torelease the hooks. BUG: memory leak unreferenced object 0xffff88810180b100(size 96): comm "syz-executor133", pid 3619, jiffies 4294945714 (age12.690s) hex dump (first 32 bytes): 28 64 23 02 81 88 ff ff 28 64 23 02 8188 ff ff (d#.....(d#..... 90 a8 aa 83 ff ff ff ff 00 00 b5 0f 81 88 ff ff................ backtrace: [<ffffffff83a8c59b>] kmallocinclude/linux/slab.h:600 [inline] [<ffffffff83a8c59b>]nft_netdev_hook_alloc+0x3b/0xc0 net/netfilter/nf_tables_api.c:1901[<ffffffff83a9239a>] nft_chain_parse_netdevnet/netfilter/nf_tables_api.c:1998 [inline] [<ffffffff83a9239a>]nft_chain_parse_hook+0x33a/0x530 net/netfilter/nf_tables_api.c:2073[<ffffffff83a9b14b>] nf_tables_addchain.constprop.0+0x10b/0x950net/netfilter/nf_tables_api.c:2218 [<ffffffff83a9c41b>]nf_tables_newchain+0xa8b/0xc60 net/netfilter/nf_tables_api.c:2593[<ffffffff83a3d6a6>] nfnetlink_rcv_batch+0xa46/0xd20net/netfilter/nfnetlink.c:517 [<ffffffff83a3db79>] nfnetlink_rcv_skb_batchnet/netfilter/nfnetlink.c:638 [inline] [<ffffffff83a3db79>]nfnetlink_rcv+0x1f9/0x220 net/netfilter/nfnetlink.c:656[<ffffffff83a13b17>] netlink_unicast_kernel net/netlink/af_netlink.c:1319[inline] [<ffffffff83a13b17>] netlink_unicast+0x397/0x4c0net/netlink/af_netlink.c:1345 [<ffffffff83a13fd6>]netlink_sendmsg+0x396/0x710 net/netlink/af_netlink.c:1921[<ffffffff83865ab6>] sock_sendmsg_nosec net/socket.c:714 [inline][<ffffffff83865ab6>] sock_sendmsg+0x56/0x80 net/socket.c:734[<ffffffff8386601c>] ____sys_sendmsg+0x36c/0x390 net/socket.c:2482[<ffffffff8386a918>] ___sys_sendmsg+0xa8/0x110 net/socket.c:2536[<ffffffff8386aaa8>] __sys_sendmsg+0x88/0x100 net/socket.c:2565[<ffffffff845e5955>] do_syscall_x64 arch/x86/entry/common.c:50 [inline][<ffffffff845e5955>] do_syscall_64+0x35/0xb0 arch/x86/entry/common.c:80[<ffffffff84800087>] entry_SYSCALL_64_after_hwframe+0x63/0xcd

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48691` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-gcp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1004.4').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
